intro: Vincetoxicum microstachys, commonly known as the narrow-stalked thornapple, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in summer. Its fruits are follicles that contain toxic seeds, which are a defense mechanism against herbivores. Vincetoxicum microstachys is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique floral structure.
